stoic.name: Stoic Philosophers
stoic.description: Marcus Aurelius, Epictetus, and Seneca on resilience and focus

chaos.quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
It is not things that disturb us, but our judgments about things.
You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

lower_aeons.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
No man is free who is not master of himself.
Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.

middle_aeons.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.

upper_aeons.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
We suffer more in imagination than in reality.
Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.

treasury.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life.
How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does.
Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.

chaos.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
chaos.encouragement: Release attachment to the old code.

chaos.quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.

lower_aeons.quote: The soft overcomes the hard. The slow overcomes the fast.
To attain knowledge, add things every day. To attain wisdom, remove things every day.
He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.

middle_aeons.quote: Act without expectation.
middle_aeons.encouragement: Do the work for its own sake.

middle_aeons.quote: The Tao that can be told is not the eternal Tao.
Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.

upper_aeons.quote: The Master does nothing, yet leaves nothing undone.
In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple.
When you are content to be simply yourself, everyone will respect you.

treasury.quote: The Tao nourishes all things.
Success is as dangerous as failure. Hope is as hollow as fear.
Retire when the work is done; this is the way of heaven.

bofh.name: BOFH (Bastard Operator From Hell)
bofh.description: Tech humor for debugging sessions and outages

chaos.quote: It's not a bug, it's a feature.
Have you tried turning it off and on again?
The problem exists between keyboard and chair.

lower_aeons.quote: Strstrstrrstrstrstrtstrstrst
We don't support that. We never have. We never will.
The backup system is working perfectly. Unfortunately, the restore system isn't.

middle_aeons.quote: Users are like cattle. Sometimes you have to thin the herd.
Whose fault is it? The network's, obviously.
The system isn't slow, it's just contemplating.

upper_aeons.quote: I don't have a solution, but I do admire the problem.
The nice thing about standards is there are so many to choose from.
upper_aeons.encouragement: Pick one and stick with it.

upper_aeons.quote: A user's cry for help is just noise. A server's cry for help is a priority one incident.

treasury.quote: It's not the logs that lie, it's the users.
In the land of the blind, the one-eyed sysadmin is king.
The server room is my happy place. No users allowed.

chaos.quote: A program should be light and agile, its subroutines connected like pearls on a string.
There is a time for debugging and a time for coding. Do not confuse the two.
Though a program be but three lines long, someday it will have to be maintained.

lower_aeons.quote: A well-written program is its own heaven; a poorly-written program is its own hell.
Without the wind, the grass does not move. Without software, hardware is useless.
The wise programmer is told about Tao and follows it. The average programmer is told about Tao and searches for it.

middle_aeons.quote: When managers make commitments, game programs are ignored. When programmers make commitments, corporate programs are made.
A novice asked the Master: 'What is the true meaning of programming?' The Master replied: 'Eat when you are hungry. Sleep when you are tired. Code when you are ready.'
The best software is invisible.
middle_aeons.encouragement: Users should see results, not complexity.

upper_aeons.quote: There was once a programmer who worked upon microprocessors. 'Look at how well off I am here,' he said. 'I have the smallest office, the smallest desk, and I must sit on the floor.'
The Master said: 'A well-designed system needs no manual.'
Let the programmers be many and the managers few -- then all will be productive.

treasury.quote: After three days without programming, life becomes meaningless.
The Master said: 'That program is good that has few bugs.'

A master programmer passed a novice programmer one day. The master noted the novice's preoccupation with a hand-held game. 'Excuse me,' he said, 'may I examine it?' The novice handed it to him. 'I see that the game requires you to push buttons to make helicopters and tanks shoot each other,' said the master. 'That is correct,' said the novice. 'But it has no purpose.' The master threw the game to the ground and crushed it under his heel. 'Neither does your code,' said the master. The novice was enlightened.

chaos.quote: Anything that can go wrong will go wrong.
Left to themselves, things tend to go from bad to worse.
If there is a possibility of several things going wrong, the one that will cause the most damage will be the one to go wrong.

lower_aeons.quote: Nothing is as easy as it looks.
Everything takes longer than you think.
Every solution breeds new problems.

middle_aeons.quote: It is impossible to make anything foolproof because fools are so ingenious.
Hofstadter's Law: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.
The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90%.
middle_aeons.encouragement: The last mile is the hardest.

upper_aeons.quote: If you make something idiot-proof, someone will make a better idiot.
The light at the end of the tunnel is just the light of an oncoming train.
For every action, there is an equal and opposite criticism.

treasury.quote: If Murphy's Law can go wrong, it will.
The primary function of the design engineer is to make things difficult for the fabricator and impossible for the serviceman.
Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall not be disappointed.

chaos.quote: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles.
Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.

lower_aeons.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
Let your plans be dark and impenetrable as night.

middle_aeons.quote: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory.
The quality of decision is like the well-timed swoop of a falcon.
Move swift as the Wind and closely-formed as the Wood.

upper_aeons.quote: To know your Enemy, you must become your Enemy.
The greatest victory is that which requires no battle.
He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.

treasury.quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war.
There are not more than five musical notes, yet their combinations give rise to more melodies than can ever be heard.
The whole secret lies in confusing the enemy.
treasury.encouragement: Complexity is the enemy of security.

chaos.quote: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven.
Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
Where there is no vision, the people perish.

lower_aeons.quote: The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and whatever you get, get insight.
A soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
Commit your work to the Lord, and your plans will be established.
lower_aeons.encouragement: Do good work, trust the process.

middle_aeons.quote: The hand of the diligent will rule, while the slothful will be put to forced labor.
Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues with injustice.
The heart of the discerning acquires knowledge; the ears of the wise seek it out.

upper_aeons.quote: Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might.
Two are better than one, because they have a good reward for their toil.
A good name is to be chosen rather than great riches.

treasury.quote: She looks well to the ways of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness.
Let another praise you, and not your own mouth; a stranger, and not your own lips.
The end of a matter is better than its beginning, and patience is better than pride.

chaos.quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves.

lower_aeons.quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
All things are ready, if our minds be so.
What's past is prologue.

middle_aeons.quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce.
Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
middle_aeons.source: All's Well That Ends Well, Act 1

middle_aeons.quote: The better part of valour is discretion.

upper_aeons.quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
To thine own self be true.

treasury.quote: All's well that ends well.
Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt.
The web of our life is of a mingled yarn, good and ill together.
treasury.source: All's Well That Ends Well, Act 4

chaos.quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.

lower_aeons.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.

middle_aeons.quote: The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
By three methods we may learn wisdom: by reflection, which is noblest; by imitation, which is easiest; and by experience, which is the bitterest.
Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.

upper_aeons.quote: The man of virtue makes the difficulty to be overcome his first interest; success only comes later.
If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.
The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.

treasury.quote: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
treasury.encouragement: Write code you'd want to maintain.

treasury.quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
When you see a worthy person, endeavor to emulate them.

chaos.quote: THE ALL is MIND; The Universe is Mental.
chaos.encouragement: Your mental model shapes your code.

chaos.quote: As above, so below; as below, so above.
Nothing rests; everything moves; everything vibrates.

lower_aeons.quote: Everything is Dual; everything has poles; everything has its pair of opposites.
lower_aeons.encouragement: Bugs and features are matters of degree.

lower_aeons.quote: Everything flows, out and in; everything has its tides.
The Principles of Truth are Seven; he who knows these, understandingly, possesses the Magic Key.

middle_aeons.quote: Every Cause has its Effect; every Effect has its Cause.
Gender is in everything; everything has its Masculine and Feminine Principles.
The half-wise, recognizing the unreality of the Universe, imagine that they may defy its Laws. Such are vain and presumptuous fools.

upper_aeons.quote: Mind may be transmuted, from state to state; degree to degree; pole to pole; vibration to vibration.
The wise ones serve on the higher planes, but rule on the lower.
Nothing escapes the Principle of Cause and Effect, but there are many Planes of Causation.

treasury.quote: The lips of Wisdom are closed, except to the ears of Understanding.
Where falls the footsteps of the Master, the ears of those ready for his Teaching open wide.
When the ears of the student are ready to hear, then cometh the lips to fill them with Wisdom.

chaos.quote: Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other and greater ones invariably slink in after it.
chaos.encouragement: Fix the bug now, not later.

chaos.quote: Know how to ask. There is nothing more difficult for some, nothing easier for others.
Begin with another's to end with your own.

lower_aeons.quote: A single lie destroys a whole reputation for integrity.
Know how to make use of stupidity: The wisest man plays this card at times.
Never contend with a man who has nothing to lose.

middle_aeons.quote: Think with the few and speak with the many.
The things we remember best are those better forgotten.
Do not wait till you are a sinking sun.

upper_aeons.quote: Have knowledge and courage, they make for greatness.
Know how to withdraw. If it is a great lesson in life to know how to deny, it is a still greater to know how to deny oneself.
The sole advantage of power is that you can do more good.

treasury.quote: Attempt easy tasks as if they were difficult, and difficult as if they were easy.
Fortune pays you sometimes for the intensity of her favors by the shortness of their duration.
treasury.encouragement: Enjoy the wins, prepare for challenges.

treasury.quote: Leave off hungry. One ought to remove even from the nectar of pleasure the cup from the lips.

chaos.quote: I reign over you, saith the God of Justice, in power exalted above the firmaments of wrath.
Can the wings of the winds understand your voices of wonder?
Move and show yourselves! Open the mysteries of your creation!

lower_aeons.quote: The spirits of the fourth angle are nine, mighty in the firmament of waters.
Arise! Move! and appear before the covenant of his mouth.
Visit us in peace and comfort. Conclude us receivers of your mysteries.

middle_aeons.quote: Behold the face of your God, the beginning of comfort.
Whose works shall be a song of honor.
Move therefore, and show yourselves!

upper_aeons.quote: Gather up your garments, and harken unto my voice.
In power and presence come to us.
Whose voices the winged creatures speak.
upper_aeons.encouragement: Let your work speak for itself.

treasury.quote: I am your God, that hath created the world.
treasury.encouragement: You are the creator of your domain.

treasury.quote: Arise, saith the First. Move therefore unto his servants.
The work is finished.

pistis_sophia.name: Pistis Sophia (Gnostic Text)
pistis_sophia.description: Gnostic wisdom from the Pistis Sophia text, with journey from chaos to enlightenment

chaos.quote: I am become as a demon apart, who dwelleth in matter and in whom is no light.
chaos.encouragement: Even in darkness, the path to Light exists.

chaos.quote: I looked to the height to the Light in which I had trusted, and they gave me over to the chaos.
chaos.encouragement: Trust the process. Sophia ascended through 13 repentances.
chaos.context: When things aren't going as planned

chaos.quote: Save me out of the chaos and the darkness.
chaos.encouragement: Every cleanup sprint is a step toward the Light.
chaos.context: When you need to start fresh

lower_aeons.quote: I have turned to the Light, and it hath known my affliction.
lower_aeons.encouragement: Recognition is the first step to resolution.

lower_aeons.quote: Let not the chaos submerge me, and let not the deep swallow me.
I cried unto thee, O Light of lights, in my affliction and thou didst hearken unto me.

middle_aeons.quote: The Light hath become my salvation.
I will sing praises unto the Light, for it hath sent me its light from the height.
The Light hath heard me and saved me from all my afflictions.

upper_aeons.quote: I will praise the name of the Light, and I will sing unto it in hymns.
The Light hath power in its mystery.
I have become as a man who is freed.
upper_aeons.encouragement: Freedom to build, not just maintain.

treasury.quote: Sophia is raised to her original place in the Thirteenth Aeon.
treasury.encouragement: You've reached enlightenment. Maintain the Light.

treasury.quote: The mystery of the ineffable is completed.
treasury.encouragement: The journey continues. New mysteries await.

treasury.quote: Enter into the Light and become Light.
treasury.encouragement: Your Light illuminates the path for others.
treasury.context: When sharing your work with others

rebbe.description: Chassidic/Rabbinical Wisdom - ethical guidance, righteous conduct, spiritual debugging

tzaddik.name: ×”×¦×“×™×§ (The Tzaddik) - Path of Righteousness
tzaddik.description: The Righteous One - perseverance, ethics, staying on the right path

chaos.quote: ×›Ö´Ö¼×™ ×©Ö¶××‘Ö·×¢ ×™Ö´×¤Ö¼×•Ö¹×œ ×¦Ö·×“Ö´Ö¼×™×§ ×•Ö¸×§Ö¸× (For a righteous man falls seven times and rises.)
×‘Ö°Ö¼×˜Ö·×— ×Ö¶×œ ×”' ×‘Ö°Ö¼×›Ö¸×œ ×œÖ´×‘Ö¶Ö¼×šÖ¸ (Trust in the Lord with all your heart.)
×¨Öµ××©Ö´××™×ª ×—Ö¸×›Ö°×Ö¸×” ×™Ö´×¨Ö°×Ö·×ª ×”' (The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.)

lower_aeons.quote: ×“Ö¶Ö¼×¨Ö¶×šÖ° ×—Ö·×™Ö´Ö¼×™× ×ªÖ¼×•Ö¹×›Ö°×—×•Ö¹×ª ××•Ö¼×¡Ö¸×¨ (The reproofs of discipline are the way of life.)

×‘Ö·Ö¼×¨Ö°×–Ö¶×œ ×‘Ö°Ö¼×‘Ö·×¨Ö°×–Ö¶×œ ×™Ö¸×—Ö·×“ (Iron sharpens iron.)

middle_aeons.quote: ×Ö·×¢Ö²× Ö¶×” ×¨Ö·×šÖ° ×™Ö¸×©Ö´××™×‘ ×—Öµ×Ö¸×” (A soft answer turns away wrath.)
×˜×•Ö¹×‘ ×©Öµ×× ×Ö´×©Ö¶Ö¼××Ö¶×Ÿ ×˜×•Ö¹×‘ (A good name is better than precious oil.)

middle_aeons.encouragement: Know when to code vs. communicate.

×œÖ·×›Ö¹Ö¼×œ ×–Ö°×Ö¸×Ÿ (There is a time for everything.)

×¦Ö·×“Ö´Ö¼×™×§ ×›Ö·Ö¼×ªÖ¸Ö¼×Ö¸×¨ ×™Ö´×¤Ö°×¨Ö¸×— (The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree.)
××•Ö¹×¨ ×–Ö¸×¨Ö»×¢Ö· ×œÖ·×¦Ö·Ö¼×“Ö´Ö¼×™×§ (Light is sown for the righteous.)

chacham.name: ×”×—×›× (The Chacham) - Sage Wisdom
chacham.description: The Sage - deep analysis, understanding, learning from tradition

chaos.quote: ×œÖ¹× ×”Ö·×‘Ö·Ö¼×™Ö°×©Ö¸××Ÿ ×œÖ¸×Öµ×“ (The shy person cannot learn.)
×¢Ö²×©Öµ×‚×” ×ª×•Ö¹×¨Ö¸×ªÖ°×šÖ¸ ×§Ö¶×‘Ö·×¢ (Make your Torah study fixed.)
×”Ö·×›Ö¹Ö¼×œ ×¦Ö¸×¤×•Ö¼×™ ×•Ö°×”Ö¸×¨Ö°×©××•Ö¼×ª × Ö°×ª×•Ö¼× Ö¸×” (All is foreseen, yet freedom of choice is granted.)

lower_aeons.quote: ×Öµ×™×Ÿ ×”Ö·×§Ö·Ö¼×¤Ö°×“Ö¸Ö¼×Ÿ ×Ö°×œÖ·×ÖµÖ¼×“ (An impatient person cannot teach.)
×©Ö°××ªÖ¹×§ ×•Ö¼×œÖ°×Ö·×“ (Be silent and learn.)
×Ö·×¨Ö°×‘Ö¶Ö¼×” ×ªÖ¼×•Ö¹×¨Ö¸×” ×Ö·×¨Ö°×‘Ö¶Ö¼×” ×—Ö·×™Ö´Ö¼×™× (More Torah, more life.)

middle_aeons.quote: ×œÖ¹× ×”Ö·×Ö´Ö¼×“Ö°×¨Ö¸×©× ×”Ö¸×¢Ö´×§Ö¸Ö¼×¨ ×Ö¶×œÖ¸Ö¼× ×”Ö·×Ö·Ö¼×¢Ö²×©Ö¶×‚×” (Not study but practice is the main thing.)
×”×•Ö¼× ×”Ö¸×™Ö¸×” ××•Ö¹×Öµ×¨: ×Ö·×œ ×ªÖ´Ö¼×¡Ö°×ªÖ·Ö¼×›ÖµÖ¼×œ ×‘Ö·Ö¼×§Ö·Ö¼× Ö°×§Ö·×Ÿ (He used to say: Don't look at the vessel.)
×Ö´× ×Öµ×™×Ÿ ×§Ö¶×Ö·×—, ×Öµ×™×Ÿ ×ªÖ¼×•Ö¹×¨Ö¸×” (If there is no flour, there is no Torah.)

upper_aeons.quote: ×˜×•Ö¹×‘Ö¸×” ×©Ö¸××¢Ö¸×” ×Ö·×—Ö·×ª ×‘Ö´Ö¼×ªÖ°×©××•Ö¼×‘Ö¸×” ×•Ö¼×Ö·×¢Ö²×©Ö´×‚×™× ×˜×•Ö¹×‘Ö´×™× ×‘Ö¸Ö¼×¢×•Ö¹×œÖ¸× ×”Ö·×–Ö¶Ö¼×” (Better one hour of repentance and good deeds in this world.)
×“Ö·Ö¼×¢ ×Ö·×” ×©Ö¶Ö¼××ªÖ¸Ö¼×©Ö´××™×‘ ×œÖ°×Ö¶×¤Ö´Ö¼×™×§×•Ö¹×¨×•Ö¹×¡ (Know what to answer a skeptic.)
